articles.title: Virginia Robano
articles.contents:
VR Indicadores
          
          
          Home
          About
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Virginia Robano
          
          
            
              
              Bio
              My specialisation is on the design and implementation of labour market and economic development policies.
              I am passionate about female empowerment, spurring dynamic and innovative entrepreneurship, and democratising access to knowledge. My purpose is to level the playing field and generate equality of opportunities.
              Since 2020 I am a Women in Data Science Ambassador for the Women in Data Science Conference, organised by the University of Stanford. Link to website here
              In 2013 I won the first prize on a global competition organised by the Global Development Network (GDN) which had over 700+ submissions. My research paper “The Part-time Premium Enigma: an Assessment of the Chilean Case” won the Medal on Research and Development / Social Protection. The award was received in Manila, Philippines.
              I have ample international experience, having worked and lived in the United States (worked at the World Bank and Inter-American Development Bank), France (OECD and Sciences Po), Argentina (Universidad Torcuato di Tella, World Bank regional office) and Uruguay (Central Bank of Uruguay, Plan Ceibal). My current location is London, UK.
              
              
              Education
              PhD in Economics | 2012 | The George Washington University, Washington DC, USA
              MA in Economics | 2004 | University of Maryland at College Park, MD, USA
              Licenciada en Economía | 2000 | Universidad de la República, Montevideo, Uruguay
              
              
              Languages
              English
              French
              Spanish
              
              
              Fields of Specialisation
              Data Science
              Impact Evaluation
              Entrepreneurship Finance and Regulation
              Responsible Innovation; Policy design, implementation and analysis
              Intergenerational mobility
